author: louissealey1
title: John Terry dedicates Instagram post to Chelsea midfielder N’Golo Kante
text:
Chelsea captain John Terry paid tribute to N’Golo Kante (Picture: Getty) Nâ€™Golo Kante has been a revelation in the Premier League since arriving in England in 2015.
Joining Leicester City for a meagre fee in the region of ÂŁ5.6million, Kante proved a hit at the King Power Stadium with his incredible work-rate.
Arsenal legend reveals the frustrating reason Gunners ALWAYS flop in Europe The 25-year-old was a hugely influential feature in Claudio Ranieriâ€™s title-winning side last season, narrowly missing out on the PFA Player of the Year award.
But Kante could well get his hands on the award this term â€“ along with a successive Premier League title â€“ after flourishing under Italian Antonio Conte.
The Frenchman has played all-but one of Chelseaâ€™s Premier League games this season, once again developing as one of the stars of the campaign.
Chelsea fixtures Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar
Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Bournemouth (A) – Sat 8 Apr
Manchester United (A) – Sun 16Â Apr
Southampton (H) – Sun 23 Apr
Everton (A) – Sun 30 Apr
And it appears Kante is just as popular in the Chelsea dressing room as he is with Blues fans, with John Terry the latest to hail the maestroâ€™s ability.
The club captain uploaded a picture of Kante to Instagram, accompanied with the words: â€˜70 per cent of the world is covered by water, the other 30 per cent is covered by Kante.â€™
(Picture: Instagram) More: Football Chelsea on red alert as Koeman admits Everton could be forced to sell huge star

Ronald Koeman fires warning to Romelu Lukaku amid Chelsea transfer links 
Chelsea, who are 10 points clear in the title race, face mid-table Stoke City this weekend hoping to seal their 22nd league victory of the season.
